question.title: How to use Maven Daemon within Maven wrapper (or why mvn wrapper:wrapper -DmvndVerstion=1.0.2 did not work)
question.body:
I was trying to add Maven Wrapper to new project.

Usually it is just mvn wrapper:wrapper

I noticed though that there some other properties via mvn wrapper:help -Ddetail=true for Maven Daemon, and wanted to use it.

Quote:

wrapper:wrapper
  Unpacks the maven-wrapper distribution files to the current project source
  tree.

  Available parameters:

...

    mavenVersion
      The version of Maven to require, default value is the Runtime version of
      Maven. Can be any valid release above 2.0.9
      User property: maven

    mvndVersion
      The version of Maven Daemon to require.
      User property: mvnd

So I tried mvn wrapper:wrapper -DmvndVerstion=1.0.2 (or with additionally mavenVersion) but both results have no use of Maven Daemon at all.

So how to use Maven Daemon within Maven wrapper? mvndVersion property is not used.

answers.body:
As suggested by @Turing85,
one should use mvnd instead of mvndVersion property, so

mvn wrapper:wrapper -Dmvnd=1.0.2

And results like:

./mvnw --version

question_comments.body: Indeed, and the documentation states property name right. Thanks
